jPokémon: The Pokémon API

Provides well-documented data structures and utilities for Pokémon games written in Java.

org.jpokemon.pmapi.item
Interface IndexedItemManager

public interface IndexedItemManager

Provides an interface for storing and keeping track of items at runtime. Although an Item does not have an inherent id value attached to it, any practical system to keep track of them will index them. For this reason, the add() method of this interface requires an id number.

This interface also provides two ways to access items, each serving a different kind of lookup for different applications. There is of course no obligation to implement this manager in your own project. It is merely an illustration of what you will probably require.

Method Summary
 void addItem(Item item, int id)
          Adds an item to this manager under the given index number.
 Item getItem(int id)
          Retrieves an item by its index number.
 Item getItem(String name)
          Retrieves an item by name.
 Collection<Item> getItems()
          Gets all of the items this manager is aware of.
